label: A8B2C_cP44_198_2a2b_2a_a-001
title: Low-Temperature ZrW$_{2}$O$_{8}$ Structure
comments:
Unusually, both ZrW$_{2}$O$_{8}$ and HfW$_{2}$O$_{8}$ have a negative thermal expansion over temperatures ranging from 0.3K to 693K. (Evans, 1996) 
 Below $\approx$423K these compounds are in the \href{current_web_home_dir/A8B2C_cP44_198_2a2b_2a_a-001}{low-temperature ZrW$_{2}$O$_{8}$ structure}, sometimes referred to as $\alpha$-ZrW$_{2}$O$_{8}$. 
 Above the transition the compounds are in the somewhat disordered \href{current_web_home_dir/A10B4C_cP60_205_2cd_2c_a-001}{high-temperature ($\beta$) ZrW$_{2}$O$_{8}$ structure}. 
 We use the data taken for LT ZrW$_{2}$O$_{8}$ at 293K.
